"I definitely don't think it will sell even one-third of what Switch did" unbelievably pessimistic, maybe bait level?

A very broad comparison would be somewhere between ds to 3ds, 150 to 75m a 50% drop (big hit recent handheld, direct sequel, gimmick didn't sell) or so and the PS4 to PS5 (recent big hit console, direct sequel) which is largely flat. It probably wont even see a drop like 360's 86 to xbox one's 57 of 66% (this feels like worst case scenario territory already, so a third is just ludicrous). Not to mention the growing brand share of mind after the Mario Movie and multi media investment.

I think Ps1>2 and 2>3 are very unlikely comparisons due to their very large swings. And we also aren't getting full repeat of the Wii to Wii U situation, given the Switch's install base isn't mostly fairweather and they would need to make multiple and expensive baffling mistakes to repeat a Wii U level failure.

I'd be very confident in a 75-115% comparison to switch sales over an 8ish year life cycle. (Assuming a normal economic cycle, only a regularish sized recession and the usually recovery afterwards, I can't account for a lost decade in these assumptions).
